channel.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
channel.description: Well I was trying to find a client that I could use to test some models I created. However this client needed to have a class8 file and needed to be 317. I found one that worked great and even had an ip changer. But when I typed in my ip it said error connecting to server. I know I portforwarded correctly and I had No-Ip running. So if anyone could help me with this problem or suggests a client I could use to test my models that'd be great. Please I got some good models and excited to test them out.

item.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
item.dc:creator: @oldschoolscape oldschoolscape
item.description:
@oldschoolscape wrote:

serpent22:

One more question…once I am on the client…How can I give myself admin and spawn these items…if there is no character files in the client files.

char files… your acc… player rights 3

Read full topic

item.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

its on your source files. make sure you are logged out before editing the character files.

item.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
item.dc:creator: @serpent22 serpent22
item.description:
@serpent22 wrote:

So all I gotta do is click run.bat for the client, let it load, and then just type 127.0.0.1 in the ip part??

Read full topic
item.source: Having trouble loggin in to my server

item.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
item.description:
@5111 wrote:

The problem may be… your trying to connect with your no-ip (used for other people to connect)

try connecting with 0.0.0.0 (allows you to connect with local host)

Read full topic
item.source: Having trouble loggin in to my server

item.title: Having trouble loggin in to my server
item.dc:creator: @Darkning Darkning
item.description:
@Darkning wrote:

dont type your ip. either leave it blank or type 127.0.0.1

Read full topic
